text: Yes, that is indeed the caveat. For a truly unexpected event, let's say it happened before the market opened, we couldn't do anything about it as the strategy does not have positions. But what we observed is that in almost all past crises in the market, the movement of price does not happen only over an overnight gap. It always carries over multiple hours, maybe even multiple days or multiple weeks. And a very simple example is the most recent crisis, the COVID-19 crisis. People have been reporting about bad news out of China throughout January and epidemiologists were sounding the increasing alarm in February. Yes, the market was completely calm, all time high in February, no problem. And it is only as news gets worse and worse that the panic got set in. And so there was a lot of panic. no particular need to get in on the first bit of news. Now, even if for truly unexpected event, like for example, 911, certainly the market gapped down after multiple days of halted exchange. But once it opened, it did not just gap down and then recover. It gap down and it went down some more. And that's also true for the financial crisis of 2008. The reason for this kind of trend is that major institutional investors need time to unload their position or to rebalance the position or to hedge positions. Whatever these measures are taken, it cannot be taken instantaneously as the market opens. It has to take some time to unload billions, if not trillions of dollars of assets. It has to gradually buy enough options or futures to hedge these trillions of dollars of assets. And that large amount of rebalancing and hedging activity is what we are trying to piggyback on in a tail hedge strategy. And as I said, the hedge ratio is crucial. Even though we might have missed the large gap opening, let's say the market was already down 15% at the opening. Well, as long as we lever the strategy appropriately, even if the market only has another, let's say, 3% to run. During the day, well, if you leverage five times, you will be able to capture the entire 15% run that you have missed overnight.
